000001.question: What would you need to believe about yourself in order to dream without limits?
000001.quote: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
000001.author: Theodore Roosevelt

000002.question: What’s scarier to you—falling short of your dreams, or realizing you’ve always had the power to reach them?
000002.quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure.
000002.author: Marianne Williamson

000003.question: What would your life look like if you fully committed to becoming the person your dreams require?
000003.quote: You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them.
000003.author: Michael Jordan

000004.question: If your future self could hand you one bold decision to make today, what would it be?
000004.quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
000004.author: Albert Einstein

000005.question: If you knew your dream would work—but only if you never looked back—would you still go?
000005.quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
000005.author: Albert Einstein

000006.question: What would your life look like if you had never learned to doubt yourself?
000006.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
000006.author: Marcel Proust

000007.question: If your thoughts from the past 24 hours were projected onto a wall, would you recognize yourself?
000007.quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
000007.author: Carl Jung

000008.question: If your private thoughts were honest, how often would they contradict the person you present?
000008.quote: The most terrifying thing is to accept oneself completely.
000008.author: Carl Jung

000009.question: What habit do you call “who I am” that is really just something you never challenged?
000009.quote: We become what we do repeatedly.
000009.author: Will Durant

000010.question: If someone followed you for a week, would your actions reflect your values—or your fears?
000010.quote: Your actions are your loudest beliefs.
000010.author: Brendon Burchard

000011.question: If you woke up five years from now, what would tell you immediately that you stayed on the same path?
000011.quote: Change happens when the pain of staying the same is greater than the pain of change.
000011.author: Tony Robbins

000012.question: Picture your deathbed. An interviewer leans in and asks: 'What was the point?' You have one sentence. Say it now.
000012.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
000012.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

000013.question: The universe grants you immunity from failure for one attempt. Just one. What do you try? Why haven't you tried it anyway?
000013.quote: What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?
000013.author: Robert H. Schuller

000014.question: There's a parallel version of you who made the brave choice five years ago. What are they doing this morning that you're not?
000014.quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst is to do nothing.
000014.author: Theodore Roosevelt

000015.question: Fast-forward 20 years. Your grandchild asks: 'Did you ever go for it?' What do you want to be able to answer?
000015.quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do.
000015.author: Mark Twain

000016.question: If someone replayed your last five difficult conversations, what pattern would they notice?
000016.quote: Between stimulus and response there is a space.
000016.author: Viktor Frankl

000017.question: Imagine you wake up tomorrow and nobody remembers you. No reputation. No history. Just you. Who would you finally allow yourself to be?
000017.quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
000017.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

000018.question: Your phone unlocks with your most repeated inner lie. What's the passcode?
000018.quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself.
000018.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

000019.question: If you could only be known for one single truth about yourself—not achievement, not role—what would you want that truth to be? Now: do you live like it?
000019.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
000019.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

000020.question: A documentary camera follows you for 72 hours without your knowledge. Which scene would make you want the footage destroyed?
000020.quote: Character is what you do when nobody's watching.
000020.author: John Wooden
